definition: to stumble/to slip/variant of 達|达[da2]
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]

sentences.english: Efficiency is priority No. 1, people. Because waste is a thief.
sentences.chinese: 人们效率第一，由于糟跶就是盗窃行为。

sentences.english: There is too much waste in this house.
It was just an evening walk, Buck thought.
sentences.chinese: 巴克以为这不过是一次傍晚的遛跶。

sentences.english: He was the same as usual during their walk.
sentences.chinese: 他和平时一样蹓跶了一阵子。

sentences.english: The old man bumble along the road.
The prisoner trails behind, his head bowed, bootlaces skipping along the ground.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯紧随其后，头低垂，松散的鞋带一路蹦跶着。

sentences.english: I liked to walk up Fifth Avenue and pick out romantic women from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在五号路上蹓跶，在人群中选挑风流的女人。

sentences.english: Drinks in hands, they wandered around the perimeter of the ball field.
sentences.chinese: 他们手里拿着饮料在球场周围漫不经心地遛跶。

sentences.english: Only by this way, can we hope to reduce the waste on campus.
sentences.chinese: 唯有通过这样的措施，替考才有希望省略校园糟跶。

definition: to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to stroll/to go for a walk
(dialect) to rush off/to scamper off double-quick/to take to one's heels/to make oneself scarce
